name: politico
text: Today marks the 31st anniversary of the massacre in Tiananmen Square, in which the Chinese government crushed pro-democracy activists and then spent decades lying about what had happened and suppressing truthful accounts https://t.co/HF9KxAX7Ii https://t.co/rSzSGuqg44

name: politico
text: On Tuesday, a day after peaceful White House protesters were attacked with tear gas by police, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo criticized China for disallowing a Tiananmen remembrance vigil in Hong Kong and met privately with survivors of the massacre https://t.co/HF9KxAX7Ii

name: politico
text:
The fight to control the narrative and shape the meaning of major events in the U.S. is usually more subtle. Like Pompeo, we all like to believe that Tiananmen-level suppression of the truth is out of the question in America.‚Å£‚Å£‚Å£
 https://t.co/HF9KxAX7Ii

name: politico
text: The past week has presented some challenges to that assumption. @RyanLizza spent the last few days outside the W.H. covering the demonstrators, inside listening to the new press secretary & watching Trump maneuver to take advantage of yet another crisis.  https://t.co/HF9KxAX7Ii

name: politico
text: Something seems different from previous incidents of police violence about the fight to control the story of the George Floyd protests https://t.co/HF9KxAX7Ii

name: politico
text: The core grievance that has sparked these events is morally unambiguous: American cops murdering black men. But on the ground things are messy. https://t.co/HF9KxAX7Ii
